* Lön och förmåner: Konkurrenskraftig fast eller rörlig lön. Goda utvecklingsmöjligheter och generösa förmåner. Tjänstepension, omfattande försäkringar.
* Placering: ESSIQ Öst– Stockholm.


**OM ESSIQ**
 ESSIQ är teknikkonsultföretaget där allt börjar med dig. Med fokus på individen, flexibla lösningar och en modern lönepolicy attraherar vi de skarpaste, mest professionella och engagerade personerna i branschen. Med denna vision grundades ESSIQ år 2005, sedan dess har vi utvecklats till ett framgångsrikt företag med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg och Malmö. Vi består idag av över 250 medarbetare med olika bakgrund, personlighet och nationalitet, med en god fördelning av kvinnor och män.
   

  

 Vi har över 80 aktiva kunder i spännande branscher – allt från de stora aktörerna till de små innovationsföretagen. ESSIQ:s medarbetare arbetar med användarcentrerad tjänste- och produktutveckling inom följande tjänsteområden: UX & Service Design, Connected & Embedded Systems, IT & Cloud Services, Green Technology & Electromobility, Test & Quality Engineering, Agile Management, Mechanical Engineering samt Simulation & Visualization. Kompetensen levererar vi på plats hos uppdragsgivaren, inhouse och i satellit. Våra medarbetares intressen och ambitioner leder vägen – vårt mål är att göra den perfekta matchningen av individ och uppdrag.
   

  

 ESSIQ är ett familjärt och socialt företag med visionen att vara Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare för alla medarbetare, oavsett roll i organisationen. Vi lägger stor vikt vid gemenskap och har ett uppskattat utbud av professionella och sociala aktiviteter. Vår kommunikationsplattform genomsyras av öppenhet, och främjar nätverkande och kompetensutbyte såväl som fritidsaktiviteter och relationsbyggande.
   

  

**ANSÖKAN**
 Urval sker löpande.
   

  

**KONTAKT**
 Frågor om tjänsten? Kontakta: Malin Meyer, malin.meyer@essiq.se, 070-217 28 69
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om ESSIQ?
   

  

 Besök http://essiq.se och följ oss på våra sociala medier!

title: Senior Product Manager – Energy Intelligence (12 Month Contract)
description:
10% of Europe's CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating, and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we're making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions, and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for a Senior Product Manager to lead the strategy, roadmap, and execution of our next-generation
 **Energy Intelligence** 
 platform. This role sits at the intersection of user experience and AI across our home energy system – heat pump, inverter, battery and solar. You will shape the direction to ensure our intelligence delivers real, scalable customer value.
   

  

 This is an opportunity for a product leader who thrives on strategic thinking, technical depth, and complex cross-team collaboration.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Own the product strategy, priorities and OKRs for Energy optimisation and Aira Intelligence.
* Turn customer insights, strategic goals, and market trends into clear and actionable product direction.
* Build a deep understanding of the emerging energy and flexibility markets in Europe
* Collaborate closely with UX-, App-, IoT- and Connectivity- teams to deliver high-impact intelligence features.
* Lead and manage external partner relationships and integration roadmaps.
* Guide your team in problem framing, success metrics, and customer value. As well as trade-offs, prioritization, and complex technical decision-making.
* Champion and evangelize Intelligence features across internal and external communication.


 We're transforming how clean energy solutions are designed and brought to customers across Europe. If you're motivated by solving challenging product problems in a mission-driven, high-growth environment, this role offers real impact and visibility.
   

  

**What You Bring To The Team**
* Proven experience in product management, ideally within energy and/or ML/AI
* Strong strategic judgment with the ability to balance customer needs, business priorities, and technical constraints.
* Ability to go discuss in depth with technical teams — models, optimisation logic, data flows, architecture
* Experience working with cross-functional teams and external partners.
* Excellent communication and an ability to bring clarity to complex domains.


**Bonus Experience** 
 (any combination of these is valuable):
   

  

  

* High-growth, scaling environments with rapid market expansion
* Background in energy markets, VPPs, flexibility services, demand response, or energy trading.


**What is in it for you?**
* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up, with a supportive and inclusive culture, and career advancement opportunities.
* Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally.
* Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment.
* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world.
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth.
* Enjoy the flexibility of our hybrid work model and discover our brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan stations just a few minutes' walk away


 At Aira, we champion the next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

title: Android Developer
description:
**At Hemnet, you’ll join a small, supportive Android community that thrives on collaboration and continuous learning. We work with a modern Android stack and give the freedom to introduce the latest improvements in Android development to the project. Whether you’re passionate about UX, app architecture, or improving developer tooling, there’s room to grow and specialise in what you enjoy working on.** 
  

  

 As an Android Developer, you will work in one of our product development teams as well as playing a big role in our App community consisting of 7 Android Developers and 11 iOS Developers working daily in creating a crisp and delightful UI for our users.
   

  

 You will join our Account team which is at the heart of Hemnet’s personalized experience, with the mission to guide users to relevant personalized content and to unify user identity and CRM to enable cohesive and personalized communication.You will contribute to all stages in the product life cycle: design, implementation, testing, deployment and maintenance. Together with us you will have the ability to create a big impact on what we build and how we build it, as each team is in control of their own product decisions.
   

  

 We work with a data-driven approach in close collaboration with each other - exploring, testing and iterating. Thanks to our large amount of traffic, we quickly validate against real data and learn from new insights.
   

  

 🌱
 **What you will do** 
  

  

* Create high-quality and robust features, owning the development process from planning to final delivery and follow up.
* Work closely with passionate and experienced product managers, designers, and other engineers with different backgrounds to plan and ensure high-quality results.
* Be an active participant in the App Community and wider product development team at Hemnet.
* Proactively improve the product by fixing, maintaining, organising and automating.


  

  

**Who are you?** 
 🤩
   

  

 To become successful in this position you are reasonably up to date with the latest Android coding standards and are excited to keep up to date with the latest Android technologies
 **.** 
 You also enjoy knowledge sharing and learning together, putting extra effort into code reviews (which also makes work more fun). With an eye for design, you always strive to create simple and easy-to-understand solutions. You have experience working with consumer facing apps focusing on external users. We also believe you have worked with different kinds of release processes and truly believe in the value of automated testing.
   

  

**Here’s a peek at our stack** 
  

  

 Kotlin
   

  

 Jetpack Compose
   

  

 Coroutines and Flow
   

  

 Git
   

  

 Unidirectional Data Flow architecture (UDF)
   

  

 Compose navigation
   

  

 UI, Compose and unit tests
   

  

 Continuous Integration
   

  

**I’m your new manager** 
 👋
   

  

 Hi! My name is Staffan, and I’ll be your new manager. I’ve been at Hemnet since 2019 but just recently joined our domain called Consumers. I’m really excited to support the teams that will be working on many new and important areas for Hemnet – including personalization and smarter search features.
   

  

 My leadership style is listening, transparent, accessible, and supportive, while also challenging you to take your next step. Hopefully, we’ll learn a lot from each other and have plenty of fun as we break new ground at Hemnet. As a team, we get things done; we know when and where value can be added, and we’re clear on our priorities.
   

  

 Why did I decide to join Hemnet? I was strongly drawn to the culture and atmosphere – a wonderful combination of kindness, inclusiveness, and helpfulness, paired with high ambitions and a strong drive forward. My impression is that the people and the workplace together create the perfect foundation for you to do the best work of your career.
   

  

 At Hemnet, we believe tech is better when built together. If you want to shape not only code but also the future of Sweden’s most loved housing platform, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

**A Note on Inclusion 💚** 
  

  

 At Hemnet, we believe that diversity in gender, sexual orientation, ability, neurodiversity, cultural background and life experience makes us stronger. We welcome applicants of all identities and backgrounds.
   

  

 If you meet many but not all of the requirements, we encourage you to apply. We value curiosity, a strong sense of purpose and the motivation to learn and grow, alongside your skills and experiences.
   

  

**🏡 Your career at Hemnet** 
  

  

 With over 40 million visits each month, you’ll be part of Sweden’s most popular property platform – and one of the world’s most admired real estate platforms. But our size and reputation aren’t the only reasons why you and your 150+ colleagues enjoy working here.
   

  

 Since 1998, Hemnet has been an essential go-to place for millions of Swedes, guiding them through one of life’s biggest transitions: finding a new place to call home. We’re proud to make this life-changing, often stressful journey as seamless as possible.
   

  

 With access to vast amounts of data, you’ll have limitless opportunities to explore and create new features that enhance the experience for Sweden’s real estate agents, home buyers, and sellers.
   

  

 Our friendly Hemnet culture fosters a dynamic, playful environment where every voice is valued. Here, you’ll join a welcoming team that encourages you to thrive and grow, working alongside passionate colleagues from around the world.
   

  

**A Hybrid Way of Working** 
  

  

 Our vibrant office in central Stockholm is the hub of our collaboration and culture, providing a lively space that fosters team spirit. We come together in the office three days a week, with two flexible remote days. To be part of our team, it’s essential to be based in or near Stockholm.

title: Senior Market Development Manager
description:
**Your mission at Voi** 




 As a
 **Senior Market Development Manager** 
 , you’ll be ensuring continued growth in two of Voi's core markets, Sweden and Finland, through building and managing relationships with local decision makers, while developing the rider experience and commercial performance in the region. In this role, you will report to the General Manager and collaborate with the local Policy and Operations teams to grow Voi’s footprint and ridership in existing and new markets. This will include:
 



  




* Lead the commercial growth and transformation of our micromobility services by collaborating with city representatives, driving revenue, and delivering measurable results.
* Building relationships with city stakeholders (e.g. city administrators, public transport authorities) and managing initiatives in collaboration with other stakeholders to improve performance in line with city priorities.
* Identify growth- and change opportunities and be responsible for the implementation of these to improve profitability, customer ratings and service quality.
* Evaluating market entries, including commercial viability, regulatory readiness, and strategic fit.
* Representing Voi for cities considering micromobility, and participating in pre-tender and tender work.
* Being the point of contact for city stakeholders, ensuring compliance, addressing city and user concerns, and developing solutions that maintain strong city relationships and improve the user experience and managing negotiations with cities, ensuring terms that balance regulatory expectations with financial objectives.
* Leverage data, analytics, and market insights to understand city-level P&Ls, and collaborate with local teams on initiatives that deliver measurable improvements in profitability and efficiency.



  





**What you need to embark** 




 We’re looking for an analytical and structured business professional with the ability to build and manage relationships with external stakeholders, and work proactively to strengthen our footprint in the region. In addition to this, we believe the right person has:
 



  




* B.Sc in business, engineering or similar.
* Professional fluency in Swedish and English.
* 3–5+ years of experience in management consulting or work within operations, growth, strategy or policy, preferably in a fast-paced environment
* Proven experience managing and negotiating with external stakeholders, e.g. public sector stakeholders.
* Experience managing cross-functional projects with multiple stakeholder needs.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to quickly adapt messaging to different audiences.
* Experience working with P&Ls and performance metrics, and ability to analyse large data sets, business cases, and budgets using Excel.



  





***Don’t meet every requirement?***
*If you are excited about this role and our mission, and have relevant, transferable skills, we encourage you to apply - even if you don’t check every box.* 




  





**Why Voi?** 




 Working at Voi is more than just a job; our People Promise includes a personal voyage where you will grow as a professional and be a part of a team and culture that builds something meaningful for society. In addition to this, you’ll have the opportunity to:
 


* Join Europe’s #1 micromobility operator and one of the fastest-growing scaleups.
* Get “skin in the game” through our employee stock option program and have a direct impact on Voi’s footprint and success in Europe’s biggest market.
* Collaborate with motivated and fun colleagues towards a common goal.
* Join the micromobility revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution.



  





**Are you ready to become a Voiager?** 




 Since 2018,
 **Voi**
 has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 150,000+ vehicles in 110+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 8+ million riders with over 400+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.
 



  





**Diversity Matters** 




 As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly, collaborative and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

title: Javautvecklare
description:
**Att jobba som javautvecklare**
 Du kommer att ingå i vårt utvecklingsteam som bygger affärsstöd kopplat till Skandias privatvårdsaffär inom området risk & hälsa.
   

  

 Arbetet som systemutvecklare i vårt team är både varierande och dynamiskt, med en blandning av nyutveckling och förvaltning. Du kommer ha en central roll i utvecklingen av vårt egenutvecklade privatvårdssystem som är skrivet i Java 21. Vi arbetar med fokus på kundnytta där vi använder oss av par-och mobbprogrammering för vår utveckling i vardagen.
   

  

**I Rollen Kommer Du Få Möjlighet Att**
* Programmera och förvalta ett egenutvecklat skaderegleringssystem, baserat på Java 21 och SpringBoot.
* Utveckla applikationer i Java med integrationer till andra system.
* Jobba med Octopus Deploy och Azure DevOps för kontinuerlig utveckling och leverans.
* Använda CoPilot i IntelliJ för att ta hjälp av AI i det dagliga arbetet.
* Bidra med komplexa försäkringslösningar till Skandias privatvårdsaffär.


 Vi arbetar hybrid vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete. I rollen kommer du att rapportera till gruppchef för IT försäkringsflöden.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen**
 Ser vi att du har flera års erfarenhet av javautveckling, arbetat med IntelliJ och Git. Likväl har du jobbat med SQL server sedan tidigare. Ett grundkrav i rollen är att du kan svenska flytande både i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Meriterande för rollen är om du arbetat inom försäkrings-/ pensionslösningar, arbetat enligt ramverket SAFe samt har kunskap av att arbeta enligt ITIL-ramverk.
   

  

 Som person är du ansvarstagande, teamorienterad och kundfokuserad. Du trivs i en samarbetsmiljö där vi delar med oss av nya kunskaper mellan kollegor och verksamhet. Teamet arbetar i kontinuerlig förändring, därav är det viktigt att du kan arbeta strukturerat med god kodkvalité där kunden är central.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

*Nu går vi på ledighet, urvalet fortsätter i mitten av januari.*
 Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Peter Edholm på peter.edholm@skandia.se.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocess, vänligen ta kontakt med Harald Brehmer Talent Acquisition Partner på harald.brehmer@skandia.se.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
   

  

 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Scada Engineer
description:
**Systemingenjörer SCADA** 




 Med människor i fokus och rötter i traditionell automation är vi en av Sveriges ledande leverantörer av resurseffektiviserande system för energi, infra och industri. Vi tar ett helhetsansvar för både stora och mindre projekt med el, kraft och automation. Vi levererar även hela anläggningar där vi utöver våra automationslösningar tar ett totalansvar - människor, montagelösningar och mekanik. Genom att kombinera projektförmåga, branschkunnande och teknisk kompetens, skapar vi framgång och utveckling för både medarbetare och kunder. Våra resurser har vi samlade i eget hus vilket ger oss en värdefull samverkan och kontinuitet i projekten. För oss handlar projektförmåga om att skapa konkurrenskraft åt och tillsammans med våra kunder. Överallt där industriproduktion effektiviseras och utvecklas har Granitor Systems en naturlig och viktig roll att spela.
 



  





 Vill du ta nästa steg i din karriär och bidra till en grönare framtid? Som systemingenjörer SCADA en del av Granitor Systems, blir du en viktig del av ett kompetent och engagerat team. Vi arbetar med externa kunder inom energisektorn och strävar efter att skapa hållbara energilösningar för framtiden. Detta är en unik möjlighet att delta i uppdrag som påverkar Europas elmarknad, med fokus på innovation och energiomställning. Om du vill utveckla ett starkare, smartare och grönare energisystem – ansök nu! Vi välkomnar alla sökande, även om inte alla krav uppfylls, eftersom vi tror på mångfald och utveckling inom teamet.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter:** 




 I rollen som systemingenjör kommer du att arbeta med kundens SCADA-systemet. Arbetsuppgifterna innefattar bland annat databasunderhåll, Arbetsuppgifterna i detta uppdrag innebär att genomföra PTP-tester i labbmiljö. Teamet för PTP-tester kommer att bestå av en testledare från kunden. Kontinuerligt under projektets gång valideras migrerade data och bilder i syfte att säkerställa kvalitén. En viktig aktivitet under slutfasen av valideringsarbetet är punkt-till-punkt tester (PTP-tester). Dessa går ut på att testa fjärrhanterade objekt mellan kundens nätstationer och det nya systemet. Efterleva Granitor Systems värderingar om säkerhet och integritet, och bidra till en positiv arbetsmiljö.
 



  





**Bakgrund:** 



* Högskoleexamen med teknisk inriktning.
* Minst två års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete med elkraft
* Minst ett års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete med drift- och övervakningssystem (SCADA system).
* Minst ett års arbetslivserfarenhet av punkt-till-punkt tester eller andra strukturerade tester i SCADA-system eller andra industriella IT-system som vi bedömer som relevant.
* Minst ett års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete med kontrollanläggning i nätstationer och/eller stations RTU (Remote Terminal Unit) och/eller kommunikation mellan nätstation och driftcentral.
* God skriftlig och muntlig kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska



  





**Vad vi erbjuder:** 




 Kollektivavtal och flexibel arbetstid.
 



  





**Bra att veta:** 




**Placering:** 
 Stockholm Omfattning: heltidstjänst
 



  





**Säkerhetsprövning:** 
 Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning. För anställning hos oss kan det vara ett krav på
 **svenskt medborgarskap** 
 i vissa befattningar. Säkerhetsprövning av kandidaten kan komma att krävas!
 



  





**Beredskap/Jour:** 




 Beredskap eller jour kan innebära att du ingår i en beredskapsgruppering och har ansvar att vara tillgänglig under vissa tider. Hur ofta detta inträffar beror på hur många personer som ingår i teamet – ju fler personer, desto mer fördelas beredskapstiden.
 



  





**Kontaktperson:** 




 Siamak Hashemi (Gruppchef),
 
 siamak.hashemi@granitor.se
 




**R** 




**ekryteringsprocess:** 




 Urval och intervjuer sker löpande så sök nu!

title: Networking Engineer / Nätverkskonsult – Tele2, Kista
description:
*Som Nätverkskonsult på Tele2 befinner du dig inom teknikens framkant! Vi erbjuder dig en roll där du får arbeta i spännande och varierande projekt i Tele2s kunders miljöer inom Enterprise segmentet. För att tillgodose och möta våra kunders behov så behöver vi säkerställa att vi har marknadens vassaste nätverkskonsulter, kompetensutveckling är därför en stor del av Tele2s erbjudande till dig, där vi möjliggör tid för utbildning och nya certifieringar. Vi behöver nu fylla på med en Nätverksspecialist med placering i Stockholm.*
 På Tele2 Företag (B2B) arbetar vi varje dag för att möjliggöra ett samhälle med obegränsade möjligheter genom vår breda portfölj av it- och telekomrelaterade produkter och tjänster. Med ett team av kunniga experter hjälper vi kunder inom privat och offentlig sektor att digitalisera sin verksamhet, bli mer hållbara och uppnå sin affärspotential. Vi söker nu nya medarbetare till vårt framgångsrika team som bidrar till vår tillväxt, förstklassiga kundupplevelser och högt engagemang.
   

  

**Om Rollen**
 Networking Professional Services på Tele2 består av nätverkskonsulter samt även driftpersonal utspridda över hela Sverige. Vi är en del av Networking & Security inom B2B och våra kunder finns både inom den privata och offentliga sektorn. Du kommer att arbeta i ett team med kompetenta men framför allt väldigt trevliga och hjälpsamma kollegor. Du erbjuds en plats i en flexibel, prestigelös organisation som präglas av högt engagemang och där din kompetens kommer att göra skillnad.
   

  

 Här kan du se en kort videointervju med en av våra nätverkskonsulter:
   

  

 Möt Rhys, Nätverksspecialist på Tele2 Företag - YouTube
   

  

 Som Nätverkskonsult på Tele2 kommer du i huvudsak att vara fokuserad på projektarbete och konsultinsatser som nätverksspecialist, arkitekt och designstöd inom Enterprise Networking området. Du kommer primärt att arbeta med områden såsom säkerhet, routing/switching, SD Wan och trådlöst, men även andra uppdrag kan förekomma. Du kommer att arbeta med stora kunder som ständigt utvecklas och befinner sig i teknikens framkant.
   

  

 Rollen är placerad i Kista, Stockholm och vi erbjuder en hybrid arbetsplats.
   

  

 Anställningsform: Heltid, tillsvidare
   

  

**Vem är du?** 
 För att lyckas i den här rollen ser vi gärna att du har erfarenhet av att arbeta med installationer, konfigureringar samt drift av kommunikationslösningar, främst baserad på Ciscos och/eller Fortinet produkter. Du har även förmåga och/eller erfarenhet att agera som konsult och projektmedlem.
   

  

 Vidare ser vi att du:
   

  

* Har flerårig erfarenhet av att jobba med nätverksprodukter, routing/switching,
* Har en kunskapsnivå inom Cisco som ligger på motsvarande CCNA och CCNP
* Kan uttrycka dig väl i skrift och tal på såväl svenska som engelska.
* Har en eftergymnasial utbildning inom nätverkskommunikation eller motsvarande
* Innehar B-körkort
* Är svensk medborgare då säkerhetsklassat arbete kan förekomma


 Meriterande
   

  

* Det är meriterande om du är certifierad inom Cisco CCNA/CCNP eller CCIE samt även inom Fortinet.
* Har du kunskaper inom trådlösa lösningar och säkerhet är det fördelaktigt.
* Det är starkt meriterande om du har erfarenhet av datacenterlösningar.


 Som person är du en lösningsfokuserad lagspelare med ett starkt eget driv som proaktivt tar initiativ. Du arbetar strukturerat och metodiskt för att leverera högkvalitativa nätverkslösningar och bidra till teamets gemensamma framgång.

title: Tech Lead Manager - Data/ML
description:
Help shape the future of Sweden's largest property platform
   

  

 Data is at the very heart of Hemnet's mission. We are now looking for a Tech Lead Manager for our Data & ML team to take on a key strategic role in shaping the future of data at Sweden's largest property platform.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to lead and grow a team of talented engineers while setting the technical vision for our entire data ecosystem. If you are passionate about building "best in class" data platforms and want to make a massive impact, this role is for you.
   

  

 What you'll do
   

  

 As the Tech Lead Manager for Data & ML, you will be a hybrid leader, blending deep technical expertise with empowering people management. You will:
   

  

* Team Leadership: Lead, mentor, and grow the Data&ML team, fostering a culture of technical excellence and continuous learning.
* Technical coaching: Guide professional development by coaching engineers on design choices and introducing modern data practices.
* Strategic vision: Play a key role in shaping Hemnet’s data strategy while acting as the lead architect for our platform and MLOps infrastructure.
* Cross-functional collaboration: Partner with Product and Analytics to translate business needs into a robust, scalable data architecture.
* Data excellence: Champion data reliability, accessibility, and security, enabling teams across Hemnet to make confident decisions.
* Hands-on Leadership: Balance technical guidance with effective delegation, empowering the team to own their domains while maintaining architectural cohesion.


  

  

 Who you are
   

  

 We're looking for a leader who is as excited about architecting platforms as they are about growing people.
   

  

**Must-haves:** 
  

  

* Deep expertise in modern data platforms and a proven track record of designing, building, and maintaining scalable data architecture.
* A passionate and pragmatic leader with proven experience in mentoring and developing engineering teams, helping them adopt new practices and grow their skills.
* A strategic, architectural mindset. You see the big picture and know when to build and when to buy, always making pragmatic technical decisions that serve the company's long-term goals.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills. You can articulate complex technical concepts and new ideas to diverse audiences.


  

  

**Big plus, but not required:** 
  

  

* Hands-on experience with Machine Learning, particularly in MLOps (building and deploying ML models in production).
* Experience in a fast-paced, product-driven tech company.


  

  

 Hello from your manager 👋
   

  

 Hi, I’m Andreas and I lead the Enabler domain at Hemnet, which includes Data/ML, Platform and AI enablement. My background spans engineering and product leadership in different types of organizations, and earlier in my career I worked hands-on with building products.
   

  

 As a manager, I want to create an environment where you feel trusted, supported, and able to do your best work. My role is to provide direction and clarity so the team can focus on the right challenges and make the greatest possible impact. I’m excited to see what we can achieve and how your contribution will help move Hemnet forward.
   

  

**A Note on Inclusion 💚** 
  

  

 At Hemnet, we believe that diversity in gender, sexual orientation, ability, neurodiversity, cultural background and life experience makes us stronger. We welcome applicants of all identities and backgrounds.
   

  

 If you meet many but not all of the requirements, we encourage you to apply. We value curiosity, a strong sense of purpose and the motivation to learn and grow, alongside your skills and experiences.
   

  

**🏡 Your career at Hemnet** 
  

  

 With over 40 million visits each month, you’ll be part of Sweden’s most popular property platform – and one of the world’s most admired real estate platforms. But our size and reputation aren’t the only reasons why you and your 150+ colleagues enjoy working here.
   

  

 Since 1998, Hemnet has been an essential go-to place for millions of Swedes, guiding them through one of life’s biggest transitions: finding a new place to call home. We’re proud to make this life-changing, often stressful journey as seamless as possible.
   

  

 With access to vast amounts of data, you’ll have limitless opportunities to explore and create new features that enhance the experience for Sweden’s real estate agents, home buyers, and sellers.
   

  

 Our friendly Hemnet culture fosters a dynamic, playful environment where every voice is valued. Here, you’ll join a welcoming team that encourages you to thrive and grow, working alongside passionate colleagues from around the world.
   

  

**A Hybrid Way of Working** 
  

  

 Our vibrant office in central Stockholm is the hub of our collaboration and culture, providing a lively space that fosters team spirit. We come together in the office three days a week, with two flexible remote days. To be part of our team, it’s essential to be based in or near Stockholm.

title: Business Development Analyst
description:
A new year starts with a new role within our Business Development team. A role in the intersection of strategy, data and business. A role where your analysis actually turns into real decisions.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity for an ambitious early-career professional who thrives in an analytical environment, while also taking true end-to-end ownership: from numbers, to insight, to recommendation, to action. You’ll work right at the core of the business, where your analysis actually turns into decisions - in one of Sweden’s largest listed companies. You’ll sit close to leadership, work on real commercial questions, and help shape what Hemnet does next in a market that refuses to stand still.
   

  

 Competition is increasing, the market is changing, and new product releases happen all the time. Translation: strategy here is not a theoretical exercise. It’s hands-on, sometimes messy, and always evolving. Which also means change is easier to push, ideas move faster, and impact is visible.
   

  

 The culture? High standards, high trust, low ego. Ambitious people who enjoy solving hard problems together, and who know that progress beats perfection. If you’re the kind of person who enjoys sharp analysis, real influence, and actually seeing your work matter, you’ll probably feel at home here.
   

  

**What You Will Do** 
  

  

 In this role, you will act as an enabler for data-driven decision making. You will dive deep into the data, and actually help shape what we do next. This role comes with high expectations and equally high trust and exposure.
   

  

 Your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Building advanced quantitative analyses and business cases to evaluate new initiatives, monetization strategies and commercial opportunities
* Conduct complex analysis, and translate it into clear insights, strategic recommendations and concrete next steps for leadership, investors and the board
* Working closely with other teams such as analytics, product, tech and sales to define what analysis is needed, gather data, interpret it and turn it into business action.
* Contributing to large, high-impact initiatives, often working as a small “internal consulting team” together with senior BD managers
* Preparing and delivering presentations and decision material for senior stakeholders


  

  

**Who You Are** 
  

  

 You are a driven, analytical and humble doer who enjoys solving complex problems - and making things happen.
   

  

 You:
   

  

* Are analytically sharp, can turn your data insights into recommended action, and manage to tell the story
* Have a strong commercial mindset and naturally think in terms of value creation and business impact
* Like to get into the details of data analytics, as well as taking on a communicative role; presenting, discussing and adapting your message to different audiences
* Enjoy collaboration and understand that most initiatives cut across multiple teams
* Are motivated by responsibility, learning fast, and contributing at a high level early in your career


  

  

**Requirements** 
  

  

* :2 years of professional experience
* Academic background within Engineering, Business/Economics or similar
* Background from strategy consulting or similar analytical environments
* Strong skills in:
+ Quantitative analysis / data analytics
+ Business case & financial modelling

* Fluent in Swedish


 Bonus
   

  

* Experience with SQL and/or Tableau
* Exposure to board, investor or executive-level material


  

  

**Hi! I am your new manager** 
 👋🏽
   

  

 Hi! My name is Linnéa and I will be your new manager. I joined Hemnet six years ago and I am leading the Business Development Team here at Hemnet. We are a small but impactful team of four, that works in the center of Hemnet, collaborating closely across all departments. We value collaboration, great discussions, and a good laugh together!
   

  

 As a manager, I am transparent and try to always give insights into decisions, priorities and the bigger picture. I believe in freedom under responsibility - I will support you when needed and always be available to discuss ideas, but give you the freedom to drive your work independently.
   

  

 I strongly believe that if you have fun at work and enjoy spending time with your colleagues we will also create better results together!
   

  

 Why do I enjoy working at Hemnet so much? To me the answer is easy - the people. At Hemnet we have a unique culture; warm, open and helpful. At the same time we have high ambitions and a strong drive forward, which makes it a truly special place to work.
   

  

**A note on inclusion** 
 💚
   

  

 At Hemnet, we believe that diversity in gender, sexual orientation, ability, neurodiversity, cultural background and life experience makes us stronger. We welcome applicants of all identities and backgrounds.
   

  

 If you meet many but not all of the requirements, we encourage you to apply. We value curiosity, a strong sense of purpose and the motivation to learn and grow, alongside your skills and experiences.

title: Field Service Engineer
description:
Field Service Engineer- Sweden
   

  

 Are you ready to take your technical career to the next level with a global leader in pharmaceutical and medical technology?
   

  

 As we expand our presence across the Nordics, we’re strengthening our local service capabilities to bring world-class expertise even closer to our customers. Here, you’ll work with cutting-edge machinery, collaborate with experts across Europe, and play a key role in delivering innovative solutions that keep vital production lines running smoothly.
   

  

**Job Description**
 As a Field Service Engineer, you will step into a dynamic and varied role. You’ll be the technical ambassador for our advanced pharmaceutical machinery, traveling across Sweden and the Nordics to ensure our customers’ equipment runs smoothly and efficiently. Your work will take you from high-tech manufacturing environments to specialized labs, where you’ll tackle challenging technical issues and develop strong partnerships with both customers and colleagues.
   

  

 When you’re not traveling, you’ll typically work from home, providing remote technical support, preparing documentation, planning upcoming service visits, and following up with customers. You’ll start your journey with immersive, hands-on training at our German headquarters, learning directly from the experts who design and build our machines.
   

  

* Installation, start-up, maintenance, and repair of complex technical equipment for the pharmaceutical industry
* Troubleshoot, diagnosis and repair of machine faults and breakdowns
* Implement modifications, new products, and formats into existing equipment
* Identify ways that the machine can be improved
* Provide customer training and production support
* Provide customers with remote technical support


**Felix Matthies, Team Leader Service Technicians.**
*"At Harro Höfliger we have a family-run environment, where we treat each other with respect and appreciation. Values such as honesty, openness, and tolerance are very important here, and the flat hierarchy ensures that doors are open to everyone.*
*This supportive and appreciative environment is quite unique and is a significant factor in my motivation to work for the company. I am also motivated by the great variety in my work due to the wide range of different machine types and requirements. What I find inspiring is that technology is constantly evolving and we have the opportunity to be a part of that development."*
**Your profile**
 You are a flexible, open-minded, and positive person who thrives in a dynamic environment. You have a strong technical curiosity and a proactive, solution-oriented mindset, always eager to learn and tackle new challenges. Building trust and maintaining excellent communication with customers and colleagues comes naturally to you. You understand what it means to travel extensively (around 200 days) for work and are prepared for the lifestyle and commitment this requires. You enjoy working as part of an international team, collaborating across borders and sharing knowledge with colleagues in both Sweden and Germany.
   

  

* Solid mechatronic background; able to read electrical and mechanical drawings
* Experience in machine building, installation, and maintenance of production equipment
* Practical knowledge of mechanical, electrical, and pneumatic systems
* Technical education or equivalent practical experience in mechanical, electrical, or mechatronic engineering
* Experience with 3D CAD systems is meritorious
* A valid driver’s license is required, and a background check will be conducted as part of the hiring process
* Excellent English skills is required; German and Swedish is a plus


**What We Offer**
 We offer you the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology and contribute directly to global pharmaceutical production in a dynamic, future-proof business that is experiencing strong growth. You will be part of a supportive team environment where collaboration and knowledge sharing are central, and you will have the satisfaction of solving customer problems and making a tangible impact every day.
   

  

 As a Field Service Engineer, you will receive extensive onboarding and hands-on training at our German headquarters, ensuring you are well prepared for your role. Your professional development will be supported continuously, both on-site and through digital channels, and you will always have access to a broad international support network.
   

  

**Contact and application**
 In this recruitment we are working with recruitment consultants Maria Ahlén, 0708-49 02 88, and Cassandra Åkerblad, 0720-708970, at Intenso Teknikrekrytering.
   

  

 Send your application through the application button. Please napply asap as applications are processed continuously.
   

  

**We welcome your application!**
**About Harro Höfliger**
*Harro Höfliger is specialized in the development of customer-oriented process and production solutions for pharmaceutical and medical applications as well as market-oriented consumer products. In addition to innovative machine platforms and packaging systems, the company's core competencies also include turnkey system solutions. Since its founding in 1975, the family-owned company headquartered in Allmersbach in Tal, Germany, has been expanding continuously. Behind Harro Höfliger are around 2,200 dedicated employees from various departments and disciplines who work together to develop innovations and implement them for our customers. Read more on www.hoefliger.com*

title: Sr Director/General Manager, Field Services
description:
**Work Schedule**
 Standard (Mon-Fri)
   

  

**Environmental Conditions**
 Office
   

  

 The
 **Sr Director/General Manager** 
 will guide a successful Field Service organization to deliver service and operational excellence. This role involves driving organic revenue growth and profitability in the Instrument & Enterprise Services (IES) portfolio for EMEA. The organization features Tech Support, Field Service Engineering, and Sales functions.
   

  

 Primary goals focus on supporting IES service offerings while delivering high service levels, great customer happiness, and growing service margins through improved efficiency and increased customer share of wallet. You will work closely with key IES, Divisional, and corporate partners to ensure effective delivery of our service commitments and meet customers’ requirements.
   

  

 Managing annual service revenue exceeding $208 million, you will lead 6 direct reports and roughly 660 Field Service staff and supervisors. This role reports to the Vice President, Global Instrument Service.
   

  

 This role can be based
 **remotely** 
 (working from home)
 **anywhere in Europe** 
 . Regular international travel will be required - up to 50% of working time, including overnight stays.
   

  

**What will you do?**
* Lead and manage the EMEA Field Service teams to ensure flawless execution of service operations and customer happiness.
* Foster collaboration among teams from various areas to identify key objectives and ensure their successful implementation in the EMEA region.
* Build and implement strategies to drive growth and take advantage of opportunities for increased profitability in the market.
* Analyze complex problems and formulate clear strategies and solutions to drive business success.
* Foster and advocate Thermo Fisher Scientific's 4i values of Integrity, Intensity, Innovation, and Involvement.
* Travel up to 50% to engage with customers and provide leadership support.


**How will you get here?**
* A Bachelor or Master’s Degree is required, or the equivalent work experience and skills.
* Proven experience in management and leadership roles in a fast-paced service environment, leading remote teams.
* Outstanding verbal and written communication skills, with an advanced level of English language.
* Solid commercial insight and the capability to spot and chase growth opportunities.
* Demonstrated ability in an Applied Industry, including a background in service operations, marketing, sales, and business development.
* Demonstrated success managing a P&L, and leading businesses to profitable growth and market share penetration.
* Ability to recognize customers’ needs and offer solutions that surpass expectations.
* Experience and proven ability to work efficiently in an international environment.
* Experience working in a multinational company with demonstrated ability to lead effectively and achieve results in a highly matrixed and multi-culture operating environment.
* Ability to analyze and assimilate complicated problems to determine effective strategies.
* Dedication to Thermo Fisher Scientific's values and a strong focus on excellence.


**What’s in it for you:**
 We offer competitive remuneration, an annual incentive plan bonus scheme and a range of employee benefits! Thermo Fisher Scientific offers employment with an innovative, forward-thinking organization, and outstanding career and development prospects. We offer an exciting company culture that stands for integrity, intensity, involvement, and innovation.

title: Servicetekniker
description:
Xylem is a Fortune 500 global water solutions company dedicated to advancing sustainable impact and empowering the people who make water work every day. As a leading water technology company with 23,000 employees operating in over 150 countries, Xylem is at the forefront of addressing the world's most critical water challenges. We invite passionate individuals to join our team, dedicated to exceeding customer expectations through innovative and sustainable solutions.
   

  

**Servicetekniker till Xylem i Sundbyberg – var med och lös framtidens vattenutmaningar!**
 Vill du ha ett arbete där du får använda din tekniska kompetens, arbeta praktiskt och bidra till hållbara lösningar som gör verklig skillnad? Hos oss på Xylem får du chansen att arbeta i en organisation där innovation, ansvar och laganda står i centrum.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 I rollen som servicetekniker arbetar du med installation och renovering av olika produkter ute hos våra kunder. Du utför felsökning, reparationer, installationer, montering och ombyggnader av våra olika produkter och anläggningar. Våra produkter sträcker sig från pumpar och omrörare till turbiner och pumpstationer med tillhörande el- och styrutrustning.
   

  

 Du arbetar nära våra kunder och är en viktig del i att säkerställa att våra lösningar fungerar effektivt och pålitligt.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder dig**
* Interna utbildningar för att du ska växa i din roll och lära känna våra produkter
* Möjlighet till kompetensutveckling och karriär inom Xylem
* God ersättning och förmåner
* En välutrustad servicebil med alla nödvändiga verktyg och utrustning
* Egen väska med personlig skyddsutrustning
* Tillgång till personliga IT-hjälpmedel (PC, smartphone och iPad)


**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig som är självgående, ansvarstagande och serviceinriktad. Du trivs med ett varierande arbete, är flexibel och fattar egna beslut i det dagliga arbetet. Du har lätt för att samarbeta, och du motiveras av att hitta lösningar och ge god service till både kollegor och kunder.
   

  

**Vi Ser Gärna Att Du Har**
* Utbildning inom VVS, VA eller liknande område
* Gedigen erfarenhet inom VA, VVS eller liknande teknisk bransch
* Erfarenhet av montering, installation och felsökning i tekniska system
* Tekniskt och mekaniskt intresse samt vana vid problemlösning
* B-körkort är ett krav


 Arbetstiden är vardagar kl. 7–16. Jourtjänst på kvällar och helger kan förekomma.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Serviceorganisationen finns på 12 platser i Sverige, från Gällivare i norr till Malmö i söder. Tillsammans med våra kvalitetsprodukter erbjuder vi våra kunder långsiktiga, hållbara lösningar för deras pumpbehov – allt från reparationer och installationer till montage, svetsjobb samt el- och automationsarbeten.
   

  

**Kontakt**
 Vid frågor eller för mer information är du välkommen att kontakta:
   

  

**Daniel Långberg, HR** 
 , 070-822 74 57.
   

  

 Ansökan sker via länken, men du är också välkommen att ringa och presentera dig närmare.
   

  

**Fackliga Representanter**
**Mikael Lövås, Unionen** 
 , och
 **Rocio Piazuelo-Carrasco, Sveriges Ingenjörer** 
 , tel. 08-475 60 00.
   

  

 Join the global Xylem team to be a part of innovative technology solutions transforming water usage, conservation, and re-use. Our products impact public utilities, industrial sectors, residential areas, and commercial buildings, with a commitment to providing smart metering, network technologies, and advanced analytics for water, electric, and gas utilities. Partner with us in creating a world where water challenges are met with ingenuity and dedication; where we recognize the power of inclusion and belonging in driving innovation and allowing us to compete more effectively around the world.

title: Public Cloud Consultant Microsoft
description:
Join a dynamic team at the forefront of Microsoft Cloud services, where you'll design, implement, and manage cutting-edge Azure solutions, collaborate with talented professionals, and grow your career with personalized development plans and access to top-tier certifications.
   

  

**This is what makes the position as Public Cloud Consultant Microsoft unique**
* Take ownership as a technical Lead in a specialized service area, shaping strategic solutions and driving innovation
* Cutting-Edge Technology Exposure: Work hands-on with Microsoft Cloud technologies like Azure, Power Platform, and DevOps, keeping you at the forefront of industry advancements
* Access personalized career development, Microsoft certifications, and holistic well-being support, ensuring both professional and personal success


 As a Senior Azure Engineer, you will work with delivery projects, maintenance, development, and life cycle management of our Managed Services platforms. The position also includes 3rd line level support, incident handling, change and problem management related to our European Portfolio under Cloud Services e.g. Azure Operate, Azure Migrate, Landing Zone and Azure Ready Assessment.
   

  

 My name is Heidi Storm, Head of Microsoft Cloud Services. As a leader, I am dedicated and transparent, always championing a "Win as a Team" mentality. I believe in fostering a welcoming, supportive, and solution-oriented environment where everyone can grow, collaborate, and make a real impact.
   

  

**Your role & influence as Public Cloud Consultant** 
**Microsoft**
*Responsibility* 
 : You will be given responsibility for designing, implementing, and managing scalable cloud architectures using Microsoft Azure, while collaborating with development teams to enhance cloud-based services, automate operations, and ensure optimal performance and reliability.
   

  

*Collaboration* 
 : Together with your team, you take care of delivering our Standardized Services efficiently and effectively. You'll work closely not only with your immediate team members but also with the Sales Engineers, Project Managers, and Service Offerings teams to ensure seamless implementation and customer success.
   

  

**Core Activities**
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including Sales Engineers, Project Managers, and Service Offerings teams, to develop, maintain, and successfully deliver customer projects
* Providing 3rd line support by handling incidents, managing changes, and solving complex problems within the European Portfolio to ensure seamless service delivery
* Developing and maintaining internal support tools to optimize workflows, streamline project deployments, and assist consultants in delivering high-quality solutions


**Benefits Of Joining Dustin**
 We believe there's more to Dustin than just the benefits listed here. You'll fully understand this once you're with us.
   

  

**You can find more of our benefits below in the vacancy.**
****This is what we imagine you bring****
 We envision you as a curious and driven individual who is passionate about Microsoft cloud technologies, thrives in a collaborative environment, and enjoys solving complex technical challenges to deliver high-quality solutions.
   

  

**Additionally, It's Important That You Have**
* A bachelor's degree level of working and thinking
* 5+ years of experience in Microsoft cloud solutions, with a focus on Microsoft Azure, Power Platform, and Microsoft server infrastructure
* A strong understanding of Azure services, including Virtual Machines, Azure DevOps, Azure Kubernetes Service, Azure networking, Azure Backup, and Azure Firewall
* Experience with infrastructure as code utilizing ARM templates/JSON
* Knowledge of identity services like Windows Active Directory, Entra ID, and Entra ID domain services
* Proficient in English, as it is the main language used for all internal and external communications. Additionally, proficiency in one of the local languages spoken in Dustin’s operating countries (Danish, Norwegian, Swedish, Dutch, Finnish, or French) is a plus


****What can you expect next?****
 To Ensure a Fair Recruitment Process Free From Unconscious Bias, We Handle Your Application Anonymously And Do Not Accept Cover Letters. Please Refrain From Sending One, So That The Selection Is Based Solely On Professional Competencies. We Expect The Following Steps In The Recruitment Process
   

  

* Telephone screening with the recruiter Elza van Grootel- Coenraats
* 1st and 2nd interview with Heidi Storm & Technical Lead from the team
* 3rd interview with Jonas Sjöberg (Director for Managed Services)


 For questions about the position, please contact the TA Partner Elza van Grootel- Coenraats via e-mail

title: CGO - Account Executive
description:
**About Atos Group**
 Atos Group is a global leader in digital transformation with c. 70,000 employees and annual revenue of c. € 10 billion, operating in 67 countries under two brands — Atos for services and Eviden for products. European number one in cybersecurity, cloud and high-performance computing, Atos Group is committed to a secure and decarbonized future and provides tailored AI-powered, end-to-end solutions for all industries. Atos is a SE (Societas Europaea) and listed on Euronext Paris.
   

  

 The purpose of Atos is to help design the future of the information space. Its expertise and services support the development of knowledge, education and research in a multicultural approach and contribute to the development of scientific and technological excellence. Across the world, the Group enables its customers and employees, and members of societies at large to live, work and develop sustainably, in a safe and secure information space.
   

  

**Number Of Years Experience**
 Candidate should have a minimum of 15 yrs of experience in IT with a minimum of 8 yrs in the account management.
   

  

**Leadership**
* Acts as a role model for Atos values.
* Incorporating sales management, key account management control skills to build consistently improved business performance
* Handled Revenue and Profit budgets, development forecasts, and business scheduling activities
* Responsible for new business strategies to drive sales success and profitability
* Handled P&L for the account of minimum 5-10 M €/ year
* Experience of Manufaturing / Retail / MedTech industry in the Nordics will be added advantage


**Commercial Drive**
* Interaction with CXO level and drive account delivery with the delivery manager
* Identify new upsells and proactive solutions for customer business.
* Ensures sales activity meets client objectives/needs alongside those of Atos.
* Manage Account P&L.
* Manage CSAT and improvement plan
* Acts with urgency to resolve customer problems and roadblocks in Delivery
* Through extensive knowledge of key client stakeholders, relevant markets and Atos capability steers future activity towards high-value customer satisfaction.


**Relationship Management**
* Takes responsibility for enhancing relationships at a personal level.
* Operates with presence, conviction, and authority.
* Attains a position of trusted advisor with the client to achieve an effective sales pipeline of work.
* Owns, manages and directly influences account ABP and scusses plan.
* Remain in regular contact with your clients to understand and meet their needs
* Provide professional after-sales support to maximize customer loyalty


**Planning & Strategy**
* Leads large-scale opportunities, linking multiple Atos service lines to create and shape large-scale value propositions.
* Creates appropriate partnerships from a network of external suppliers to meet client (tender) requirements.
* Owns all planning activities within a defined account, sale (deal) or market.
* Ensures deal qualification activity coordinates with the client buying processes to enable the valuable, efficient sale.
* Owns the deal qualification process for all activity at a local level, driving through compliance and quality contributions from all internal contacts.
* Coordinates sales planning for tier 1 bids.


**Sales Behaviors**
* Demonstrates commitment and urgency in driving through actions.
* Prepares own area of responsibility for the future.
* Creates a forward-thinking culture.
* Leads and encourages knowledge sharing
* Design and implement strategic plans to reach sales targets
* Assess costs, competition, and supply and demand to identify selling prices.


**Education**
* Business Economics & Management
* Having a defense background will be added advantage


**Responsibility**
* Create and maintain excellent relations with customer/s stakeholders on multiple levels.
* Support in developing and implementing the strategy for customers in Sweden/Norway. Can operate at the top management level in the client organization.
* Manages client/sales projects and opportunities with full P&L
* Determine annual unit and gross-profit plans by implementing marketing strategies; analyzing trends and results
* Grow Atos share of wallet at the designated customer/s
* Share of wallet analysis
* Competitor analysis
* Find, shape and close opportunities to increase the share-of-wallet proportion
* Create, maintain and execute sales pipeline for the assigned customer with the size of 50 M€
* Coordinate the global team to close the deal
* Accountable and responsible for initiating and executing required tasks within this area of responsibility
* Analyze pipeline and lead data, deliver periodic reporting to the sales and marketing teams providing key business insights typical reporting relates to Demand Generation, Pipeline Forecast and Trends, Conversion Rates, Target Account, Market Segmentation, Win/Loss, Age
* Participate in the development and implementation of the strategy for either a solution or a specific account. Responsible for steering and executing sales activities and realizes sales targets.


**Sales targets**
* Overall responsibility for achieving financial targets (OE, ER, OM, Cash, WIP & Billing) measured monthly/quarterly/half year and full year
* Able to deliver 20 M€ per year
* Responsible for managing backlog
* Upsell/fertilization
* Scope expansion


**Leads and opportunities**
* By contact with prospective customers at multiple levels, prospects for new sales leads and develops existing sales leads by creating recognition of customers’ business needs and exploring how these can be met by own organization’s products and/or services.
* Leverages sales by creating leads for the complete Atos service portfolio.


**Relationship building**
* Identifies key staff at all management levels in the client organization and build long-term relationships with them.


**Business Development & Bid Participation**
* On request, participate in strategic business development, including potentially creating, developing and maintaining customer relationships for new prospects
* On request, participate in creating strategic plans for clients in business development phase
* On request, participate in bids for existing or new clients


**Negotiation**
* Negotiates with customer representatives, on both technical and commercial issues, to reach mutually acceptable terms for appropriate forms of sales agreements.
* Led high level negotiations to secure various new clients and contracts


**Advise customer on usage**
* Encourages changes in the customer orga­nization’s use of the products and services supplied, to increase the benefits it obtains from them, and to ensure customer reten­tion.


**Planning & budgeting by the customer for Atos services**
* Ensures that the management of the custo­mer organization plans and budgets for new and enhanced products and services.


**Build client & Solution knowledge**
* In case of a specific account focus, builds client knowledge focused on client issues and align Atos solutions/services in a client proposition.
* In case of a specific solution focus, builds solution knowledge in relation to specific markets.


**Market development**
* Develops new ideas for markets and translates them into implications for the organization


**Improve internal efficiency**
* Ensures that the organization continually improves its effectiveness in dealing with customers. Establishes the means of impro­ving service to, and relationships with customers. Monitors the effectiveness of such measures.

title: TECH LEAD SECURITY TILL BANKGIROT
description:
*Bankgirot söker nu en Tech Lead Security till en växande del av organisationen i Stockholm. Bankgirot har en unik ställning på Sveriges betalmarknad som nu genomgår den största transformationen i modern tid. Vår IT-organisation är i en tillväxtfas för att utveckla framtidssäkrade lösningar som följer internationell standard och regelverk. Samtidigt ser vi till att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar säkert och stabilt – varje dag.*
*Arbetet med att utveckla framtidens betalningsinfrastruktur är i full gång och vi behöver dig som vill vara en del av resan. Som Tech Lead Security får du en nyckelroll i att ansvara för att tekniska säkerhetslösningar följer Bankgirots riktlinjer avseende tekniska och säkerhetsmässiga krav. Du blir en viktig del av vår resa mot framtidens betalningsinfrastruktur på ett teknikbolag där vi har ett stort hjärta för både vårt samhällsviktiga uppdrag – och för varandra.*
 Din roll
   

  

 Vi står inför en omfattande förändringsresa där en helt ny infrastruktur byggs upp parallellt med den befintliga. I rollen som Tech Lead Security kombinerar du ett strategiskt perspektiv med praktisk implementation och leder tekniska initiativ inom ditt område, med fokus på stabilitet, säkerhet och hög tillgänglighet. Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Säkerställa att tekniska lösningar inom ditt område svarar upp mot ställda tekniska samt säkerhetsmässiga krav, exempelvis inom PKI/HSM, IAM/PAM, SIEM, EDR, NDR, SOC, IDS/IDP, SVS m.fl.
* Vara involverad i pågående implementationsprojekt och även proaktivt identifiera relevanta utvecklingsområden/säkerhetslösningar och driva igenom dessa.
* Kravställa mot övervakning- och kapacitetsrapportering.
* Bistå med kompetens vid tekniska riskanalyser.
* Nära samarbete med t.ex. Service Manager och Vendor Manager för ex. livscykelhantering, SLA m.m.
* Dela kunskap och coacha medarbetare och leverantörer för att stärka kompetensen i teamet.


 Vi söker dig som har
   

  

 För att lyckas och trivas i rollen är det viktigt att du har mycket god kommunikations- och samarbetsförmåga och lägger stor vikt vid att bygga starka relationer. Du kombinerar teknisk expertis med ett helhetsperspektiv och bidrar gärna både som specialist och som vägledare. Vi ser också att du har erfarenhet av att driva tekniska initiativ, coacha kollegor och skapa struktur i en organisation som är i förändring. Du har breda erfarenheter inom IT-säkerhet och viktigast för oss är att du har:
   

  

* Teknisk kunskap inom IT-säkerhet, ex. inom PKI/HSM, IAM/PAM, SIEM, EDR, NDR, SOC, IDS/IDP och/eller SVS.
* Erfarenhet av förvaltning av IT-säkerhetstjänster.
* Erfarenhet kring riskbedömningsarbete.
* Erfarenhet från IT-leveranser baserad på ITIL och med fördel erfarenhet av reglerad verksamhet.
* Kunskaper inom compliance rapportering/granskning/uppföljning, härdning/patchning och säkerhetsarkitektur.
* Relevant akademisk examen eller motsvarande utbildning och erfarenhet inom relevant område.


 Ett utvecklande arbete med bra förmåner
   

  

 Som vår nya kollega blir du en del av ett kompetent och positivt team där vi samarbetar och sätter högt värde på varandras kompetens och erfarenheter.
   

  

 Vi satsar mycket på hälsa och välmående och erbjuder generösa förmåner för dig som medarbetare.
   

  

 Övrig information
   

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning baserad i Liljeholmen i Stockholm. Du behöver ha goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Innan anställning beslutas genomförs en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).
   

  

 Intresserad?
   

  

 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Bankgirot med Nexer Recruit.
   

  

 Har du frågor eller funderingar? Kontakta gärna rekryteringskonsult Johanna Värmfors: johanna.varmfors@nexergroup.com eller +46 730 821 230 alternativt Jenny Nilsson: jenny.nilsson@nexergroup.com eller +46 703 018 279.
   

  

 Läs om fler lediga tjänster från Bankgirot här.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Om Bankgirot
   

  

 Bankgirot är ett svenskt clearinghus och teknikbolag med över 60 års erfarenhet av att leverera finansiell infrastruktur till banker. I samverkan med betalsektorn ser vi till att privatpersoner och företag enkelt kan göra överföringar och betalningar.
   

  

 Bankgirot säkerställer att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar felfritt, samtidigt som vi utvecklar framtidssäkrade lösningar. Vi säkrar och utvecklar Sveriges betalningar.
   

  

 Läs mer på www.bankgirot.se

title: Senior ASIC IP Verification
description:
**Join our Team**
**About The Opportunity**
 Ericsson Silicon develops tailor-made, high-performance solutions for present and future RAN needs. Our Application Specific Integrated Circuits (ASICs) power cutting-edge System on a Chip (SoC)—a game-changer in telecommunications. With signal processors (DSPs) and accelerators, our technology enables high-performance, energy-efficient, and lightweight network solutions.
   

  

 We deliver RAN Compute solutions that consume 30-60% less power than industry benchmarks through a holistic co-design approach across silicon, hardware, and software. Our flexible and modular architecture fuels next-gen connectivity with 5G and 6G capabilities.
   

  

 We are expanding our ASIC IP unit in Stockholm and Lund, pioneering industry trends. We seek an experienced Senior Verification Engineer to drive innovation and shape the future of telecommunications.
   

  

**Why Choose Ericsson Silicon?**
* Innovate with Purpose: Engage in projects that have a tangible impact on society by facilitating advanced connectivity solutions that power smart cities, IoT, and next-gen mobile networks.
* Work-Life Harmony: We believe in taking care of our people. Enjoy a balanced work-life environment where your well-being comes first so you can perform at your best without compromising your personal life..
* Dynamic and Collaborative Culture: Be part of a vibrant team that values creativity, innovation, and collaboration. Our diverse and inclusive environment encourages sharing ideas and pushing the limits of what is possible.
* Global Influence: Join a company with an extensive global reach, contributing to projects that span continents and touch millions of lives.
* Continuous Learning and Growth: Take advantage of ample opportunities for professional development, including training programs, mentorship, and career advancement pathways.


**What You’ll Do:**
* Craft and execute top-notch verification plans, ensuring every detail is covered.
* Design and refine cutting-edge verification environments for peak performance.
* Develop and maintain UVCs, leaving no design corner unverified.
* Lead both random and directed testing strategies to catch elusive bugs.
* Utilize advanced coverage techniques to achieve exceptional verification completeness.
* Drive continuous innovation, enhancing product quality, efficiency, and workflows.


**Skills You Bring**
* Expertise in ASIC or FPGA verification at IP, sub-system, and chip levels, using SystemVerilog UVM. Possibly over 8 years of experience in Verification.
* Hands On experience designing UVM test environments and driving coverage closure
* An insatiable curiosity, ready to learn something new daily and apply it to make a real difference.
* Creative problem-solving skills—you see challenges as opportunities for innovation.
* Collaborative spirit and the ability to thrive independently, with exceptional communication skills.
* Results-oriented mindset with a passion for continuous improvement, always seeking more innovative, faster solutions.
* Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related field.


**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like. We have several openings for this role, please apply with your Cover Letters
   

  

 We encourage you to consider applying to jobs where you might not meet all the criteria. We recognize that we all have transferrable skills, and we can support you with the skills that you need to develop.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
